where?  See, this question doesn't really make sense in linux.
At least, nto at your level.
Part of what makes Ubuntu so handy is that it has a whole, incredibly smart system for managing installs.
Don't worry about where the files are, at least not at your level, but rather worry about learning "package management" in linux (and ubuntu particularlly).

package management is the general phrase for the various ubuntu tools and systems (apt, aptitude, dpkg, the ubuntu repositories, distributions and releases, etc) that are used to manage installing applications on ubuntu.
Google on: ubuntu package management tutorial
